body: Why are you using a black cursor when you can't see it? I'm confused what your issue is here. You can fully adjust cursor color and thickness in Alacritty, what else are you looking for?

> 

Exactly what I want, how do I adjust the cursor color? I tried it inside my color scheme, but that only changes the block cursor's color, not the line/beam one. How do I change it??
Config cursor color affects all cursor shapes. Just make sure you're configuring the right fields.

![github_issue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/93624576/196481244-67aeb0be-0681-406f-b5ba-0450ef9996ed.png)
The issue is still not fixed, closing it doesn't seem like a good idea @chrisduerr

Neovim could also set a color for the cursor, so if you set it to something else in the theme it should work as well. It's clear not alacritty issue, since I'd assume outside of the neovim everything works as expected.

It seems actually that your GPU isn't likely our shader and silently(without error propagation to us and just logs on stdout). So the only way to solve is to simplify the shader to support your ancient GPU.

rename.from: Neovim insert cursor is not too visible
rename.to: Too many ALU instructions compiling fragment shader

body: The issue here that all rectangles will be black for you.

issue.title: Fix cursor and underlines always being black
issue.body:
Some old hardware doesn't like universal shader approach for all the rectangle kinds leading to ALU instruction limits. This commit fixes it by splitting the shader per rectangle kind.

Fixes #6417.

body: @GoodBoyNeon Could you try #6422 ? We can't verify that it'll fix your issue, since your hardware is very old, but from what I see it should be sufficient now.

issue.title: squiggly lines not rendered properly
issue.body:
In neovim, the squiggly lines for errors won't render properly using alacrity.

This is what it's supposed to look like:
![squiggly2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/93624576/197324890-f4151933-a0dc-490e-bd7c-228990900577.png)

This is what it looks like in alacritty:
![alacritty-squiggly1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/93624576/197324924-f29e06d6-24fb-4bfc-804f-7cb71828225a.png)

### System

OS: Linux
Version: alacritty 0.11.0 (8dbaa0bb)
Linux/BSD: xfce4, xmonadWM, picom

### Logs

Crashes: STDERR, STDOUT
Font/Terminal size:
